verses.verse: A Psalm<WH4210> or Song<WH7892> for the sabbath<WH7676> day.<WH3117> It is a good<WH2896> thing to give thanks<WH3034> unto the LORD,<WH3068> and to sing praises<WH2167> unto thy name,<WH8034> O most High: <WH5945>
To show forth<WH5046> thy lovingkindness<WH2617> in the morning,<WH1242> and thy faithfulness<WH530> every night,<WH3915>
Upon <WH5921> an instrument of ten strings,<WH6218> and upon<WH5921> the psaltery;<WH5035> upon the harp<WH3658> with<WH5921> a solemn sound.<WH1902>
For <WH3588> thou, LORD,<WH3068> hast made me glad<WH8055> through thy work:<WH6467> I will triumph<WH7442> in the works<WH4639> of thy hands.<WH3027>
O LORD,<WH3068> how<WH4100> great<WH1431> are thy works!<WH4639> and thy thoughts<WH4284> are very<WH3966> deep.<WH6009>
A brutish<WH1198> man<WH376> knoweth<WH3045> not;<WH3808> neither<WH3808> doth a fool<WH3684> understand<WH995> <WH853> this.<WH2063>

When the wicked<WH7563> spring<WH6524> as<WH3644> the grass,<WH6212> and when all<WH3605> the workers<WH6466> of iniquity<WH205> do flourish;<WH6692> it is that they shall be destroyed<WH8045> forever:<WH5703> <WH5704>
But thou,<WH859> LORD,<WH3068> art most high<WH4791> forevermore.<WH5769>

For, <WH3588> lo,<WH2009> thine enemies,<WH341> O LORD,<WH3068> for,<WH3588> lo,<WH2009> thine enemies<WH341> shall perish;<WH6> all<WH3605> the workers<WH6466> of iniquity<WH205> shall be scattered.<WH6504>
But my horn<WH7161> shalt thou exalt<WH7311> like the horn of a unicorn:<WH7214> I shall be anointed<WH1101> with fresh<WH7488> oil.<WH8081>
Mine eye<WH5869> also shall see<WH5027> my desire on mine enemies,<WH7790> and mine ears<WH241> shall hear<WH8085> my desire of the wicked<WH7489> that rise up<WH6965> against<WH5921> me.
The righteous<WH6662> shall flourish<WH6524> like the palm tree:<WH8558> he shall grow<WH7685> like a cedar<WH730> in Lebanon.<WH3844>
Those that be planted<WH8362> in the house<WH1004> of the LORD<WH3068> shall flourish<WH6524> in the courts<WH2691> of our God.<WH430>
They shall still<WH5750> bring forth fruit<WH5107> in old age;<WH7872> they shall be<WH1961> fat<WH1879> and flourishing;<WH7488>
To show<WH5046> that<WH3588> the LORD<WH3068> is upright:<WH3477> he is my rock,<WH6697> and there is no<WH3808> unrighteousness<WH5766> in him.
